title: League of Legends on Mac (El Capitan) won't fully close unless I go to Activity Monitor
body:
As the title says; if I don't shut it down through the activity monitor (as opposed to just logging out via the client or quitting/force quitting by right clicking the icon on the dock), it just stays open indefinitely.

For the first few days I forget to quit through the activity monitor, everything works fine, but eventually the launcher won't open until I quit through the AM and reopen. Wondering if anyone else has this problem, and if there's a fix. Thanks~

Edit: To clarify, league doesn't show up as active on the dock after I exit out of it normally, or even in the force quit menu. It's only by going to the Activity Monitor that I can see it's still running.

replies.body:
This could be caused by a background application preventing League from properly closing out. I'd recommend performing a safe-mode boot of your mac by following [**this guide**](https://support.apple.com/kb/ph18760?locale=en_US) to ensure this isn't the case.

Let me know if this caused any change.
